name: Metoro
headline: Instant in-depth observability for services running in kubernetes
description:
Metoro is an observability platform specifically for service architectures running in Kubernetes.

With no code changes or instrumentation you can get total observability into you clusters and the apps running inside of them. The entire installation takes < 10 minutes.

Out of the box you get:
Traces,
Metrics (infrastructure, application and language level),
Logs,
Continuous profiling,
Regression tracking,
Network traffic inspection,
Infrastructure monitoring,
Alerting,
Automated diagnostics

founders.name: Chris Battarbee, Founder
founders.description:
I'm one of the founders of Metoro - We're building an AI-powered production debugger.

Before Metoro, I worked at Palantir as a Software Engineer where I built out Foundry's compute platform.

Prior to that, I was at Improbable working on SpatialOS - a large-scale distributed game engine. 

I've spent my career building and debugging large-scale distributed systems and now I'm building Metoro to help others do the same!

## Frequently asked questions
## 
What is eBPF?
eBPF is a linux kernel technology that allows us to run code in response to events that happen in the kernel. This allows us to collect telemetry data at the kernel level for each container so you don't have to instrument or restart any of your containers. Checkout more at [ebpf.io](https://metoro.io/<https:/ebpf.io/what-is-ebpf/>).
## 
What happens if there's a bug in Metoro? Will it crash my host?
This is a great question and this was previously a problem with linux kernel modules. However, eBPF is explicitly designed in such a way that an ebpf program crash will not cause the kernel to crash. More info at [ebpf.io safety section](https://metoro.io/<https:/ebpf.io/what-is-ebpf/#ebpf-safety>).
## 
How does Metoro work without manual instrumentation?
Metoro uses our own eBPF programs that are loaded into the kernel of all your nodes in the Kubernetes cluster. This means you don't need to restart your containers to start collecting data.
## 
Which LLM providers does Metoro support for AI features?
Metoro currently uses OpenAI models for its AI features. The cloud offering uses Microsoft's hosted OpenAI API.
## 
Do you offer on-premises installations?
Yes, we do as part of our enterprise offering. Please contact us for more information.
## 
Do I need to enter my credit card details to sign up?
No, you don't need to enter your credit card details to sign up. You can sign up for free and use Metoro for free for limited workloads. When you're ready just upgrade to a paid plan.
## 
Is there a fair usage policy?
Yes, we have a fair usage policy. Our node-based pricing includes 100GB of data per node. If you exceed this limit, we will contact you to discuss your options.
## 
Where are your docs?
<https://metoro.io/docs>.
## 
How do I contact support?
We're available at our community [slack](https://metoro.io/<https:/join.slack.com/t/metorocommunity/shared_invite/zt-2makpjl5j-F0WcpGnPcdc8anbNGcewqw>), head on over! If you're a customer, reach out via your dedicated slack connect channel.

**Company Overview: Metoro**

**Founded:** 2023  
**Location:** London, United Kingdom  
**Team Size:** 2 employees  
**Funding:** Part of Y Combinator Batch S23  

**Mission:** At its core, Metoro aims to provide instant, in-depth observability for services running in Kubernetes. This addresses a major pain point for developers and operations teams who need to monitor and troubleshoot complex service architectures quickly.

### Key Features
Metoro stands out in the crowded observability market by offering a wide array of features right out of the box, all without requiring any code changes or instrumentation on your part. Here’s what you can expect when you set it up—generally in under 10 minutes:

- **Traces**: Gain insights into service interactions.
- **Metrics**: Get comprehensive metrics across infrastructure, application, and language levels.
- **Logs**: Collect and analyze logs from all containers easily.
- **Continuous Profiling**: Monitor your applications’ performance over time.
- **Regression Tracking**: Detect performance regressions automatically.
- **Network Traffic Inspection**: Understand traffic patterns within your clusters.
- **Infrastructure Monitoring**: Keep an eye on the health of your infrastructure.
- **Alerting**: Get notified about key performance issues.
- **Automated Diagnostics**: Simplify problem-solving with AI-driven root cause analysis.

### Technology
Metoro utilizes eBPF (Extended Berkeley Packet Filter) technology to gather observability data directly from the kernel, eliminating the need for any manual instrumentation or container restarts. This not only speeds up setup but also enhances the data's accuracy, ensuring you're getting the best possible insights.

### Pricing
Metoro has adopted a straightforward pricing model, which includes:
- **Hobby Plan**: Free for small workloads with one cluster and two nodes.
- **Scale Plan**: $20 per node per month for unlimited clusters and users.
- **Enterprise Plan**: Custom pricing with additional support and on-premises deployments.

### Support & Community
Metoro values its user base and provides access to a supportive community through Slack. This is where users can ask questions, share insights, and get help from both Metoro’s team and other users.

### Conclusion
Metoro is positioned as a robust observability platform tailored specifically for Kubernetes environments. By simplifying the installation process and eliminating the need for code changes, it allows developers to focus more on building and less on monitoring. If you're leveraging Kubernetes to run microservices, Metoro could very well be the monitor you've been searching for. Want to know more? Check them out at [metoro.io](https://metoro.io).
